title: How to Make a Candy Cake

methods.name: Making a Kit Kat Candy Cake

steps.headline: Bake or buy a cake.
steps.description: Bake a cake or purchase a cake. You can have any flavor of cake you want. Make two round cakes and stack them together with buttercream frosting in between the two cakes.

steps.headline: Frost the cake.
steps.description: Cover the cake with plenty of buttercream frosting. Make sure to use a good amount and that you put it everywhere so the Kit Kats will be able to stick to the cake.

steps.headline: Pile frosting on the top of the cake.
steps.description: Add more frosting on top of the cake and spread it out so there is a thick layer. You are going to be adding more candy to the top that needs to be able to stick to the frosting.

steps.headline: Put the Kit Kats around the cake.
steps.description: Break the regular size Kit Kats into sections of two. Spread them around the sides of the cake so they are vertical and go slightly above the height of your cake. You will probably need anywhere from 6 to 10 Kit Kats, depending on the size of your cake.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator for 10-15 minutes, until the kitkat sticks are settled.
Cover the top of the cake in candy.
steps.description: Fill the top of the cake with whatever candy you want. You can use M&M's, Wonka candy, gummy candy, Skittles, or even something different like goldfish or cookies.

steps.headline: Melt the marshmallows.
steps.description: In a saucepan, melt one package of miniature marshmallows, ¾ cup of canola oil, and ½ cup of butter. Stir them together until it is smooth.

steps.headline: Combine the candy, peanuts, and popcorn.
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine 20 cups (5 quarts) of popped popcorn, 1 package of gumdrops, and 1 cup of salted peanuts.

steps.headline: Stir in the marshmallow mixture.
steps.description: Pour the melted marshmallow mixture into the popcorn and candy mixture. Toss the ingredients in the bowl to coat the popcorn and candy in the marshmallow sauce.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the mixture.
steps.description: Press the mixture into a greased 10-inch tube pan. Don't use a two-piece tube pan for this cake. Cover the pan and refrigerate it for at least five hours.

steps.headline: Take the cake out of the pan.
steps.description: Dip the pan in hot water for 5-10 seconds. This will help unmold it. Remove the cake from the pan. Slice it with an electric or serrated knife and serve it.

methods.name: Displaying Candy to Look Like a Cake

steps.headline: Get hat boxes or Styrofoam circles.
steps.description: Purchase two or three round hat boxes or Styrofoam circles in three different sizes. You won't need the lids of the hat boxes. Glue the hat boxes together upside down or glue the Styrofoam circles together with a hot glue gun. Have the largest on the bottom and the smallest on the top. If you want, you can glue wrapping paper or colored paper on your boxes or Styrofoam before you glue them together.

steps.headline: Hot glue candy to the sides.
steps.description: Hot glue candy in their wrappers to the sides of the boxes or Styrofoam. You can use a few large candy boxes or you can use a lot of small candy. Glue the candy on the top box or top Styrofoam circle so it goes slightly past the top. This will create a “bowl” on the top of your cake. You can pour candy onto the top and the sides of the candy glued around it will keep it from falling out. Choose candy that won't melt because of the hot glue. Good candy to use to avoid melting is Airheads, Swedish Fish, Jolly Ranchers, and Nerds. Chocolate is more likely to melt, but can still work if you are careful.

steps.headline: Add bows and ribbons.
steps.description: You can tie ribbons around your "cake" and stick a bow on top of it. Add any decorations you want to make your "cake" perfect for your party.

Cover the top of the cake in candy. Fill the top of the cake with whatever candy you want. You can use M&M's, Wonka candy, gummy candy, Skittles, or even something different like goldfish or cookies. Serve and enjoy! ! Making a Popcorn Candy Cake Melt the marshmallows. In a saucepan, melt one package of miniature marshmallows, ¾ cup of canola oil, and ½ cup of butter.
